From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From en- +‎ amor +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [ə.nə.muˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [ə.nə.moˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [e.na.moˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

enamorar (first-person singular present enamoro, first-person singular preterite enamorí, past participle enamorat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /o/

  1. (transitive) to enamor
  2. (reflexive) to fall in love
    Jo m'he enamorat de l'amor
    I've fallen in love with love.

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of enamorar (first conjugation)
infinitive enamorar
gerund enamorant
past participle masculine feminine
singular enamorat enamorada
plural enamorats enamorades

vós 		ells/elles

preterite enamorí enamorares enamorà enamoràrem enamoràreu enamoraren
conditional enamoraria enamoraries enamoraria enamoraríem enamoraríeu enamorarien

vostès

imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — enamora enamori enamorem enamoreu enamorin
negative (no) — no enamoris no enamori no enamorem no enamoreu no enamorin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • enamoriscar

Further reading

[edit]
  • “enamorar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From en- +‎ amor +‎ -ar.

Verb

[edit]

enamorar

  1. to enamor

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From en- +‎ amor +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /e.na.moˈɾa(ʁ)/ [e.na.moˈɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /e.na.moˈɾa(ʁ)/ [e.na.moˈɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /e.na.moˈɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /e.na.moˈɾa(ʁ)/ [e.na.moˈɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /e.na.moˈɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.nɐ.muˈɾaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.nɐ.muˈɾaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /i.nɐ.muˈɾa.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: e‧na‧mo‧rar

Verb

[edit]

enamorar (first-person singular present enamoro, first-person singular preterite enamorei, past participle enamorado)

  1. to enamor
  2. (reciprocal) to fall in love (to come to have feelings of love towards each other)
  3. (reflexive) to fall in love (to come to have feelings of love)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of enamorar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person

enamorando
Past participle
Masculine enamorado enamorados
Feminine enamorada enamoradas
Indicative
Present enamoro enamoras enamora enamoramos enamorais enamoram
Imperfect enamorava enamoravas enamorava enamorávamos enamoráveis enamoravam
Preterite enamorei enamoraste enamorou enamoramos1, enamorámos2 enamorastes enamoraram
Pluperfect enamorara enamoraras enamorara enamoráramos enamoráreis enamoraram
Future enamorarei enamorarás enamorará enamoraremos enamorareis enamorarão
Conditional enamoraria enamorarias enamoraria enamoraríamos enamoraríeis enamorariam
Subjunctive
Present enamore enamores enamore enamoremos enamoreis enamorem
Imperfect enamorasse enamorasses enamorasse enamorássemos enamorásseis enamorassem
Future enamorar enamorares enamorar enamorarmos enamorardes enamorarem
Imperative
Affirmative enamora enamore enamoremos enamorai enamorem
Negative (não) não enamores não enamore não enamoremos não enamoreis não enamorem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • namorar

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From en- +‎ amor +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /enamoˈɾaɾ/ [e.na.moˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: e‧na‧mo‧rar

Verb

[edit]

enamorar (first-person singular present enamoro, first-person singular preterite enamoré, past participle enamorado)

  1. (transitive) to enamor
  2. (reflexive) to fall in love
    Me enamoré de mi vecina.
    I fell in love with my neighbor.
    María se enamora de Juan.
    Maria is falling in love with Juan.

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of enamorar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive enamorar
gerund enamorando
past participle masculine feminine
singular enamorado enamorada
plural enamorados enamoradas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
